speaker: Doctor
text: What other symptoms are you experiencing besides agitation and the yellowish coloring of your skin and eyes?

speaker: Patient
text: I've been feeling really restless and confused, like I can't focus on anything. Also, I've had some nosebleeds lately.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in your appetite or weight recently?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't really noticed any changes in my appetite, but I feel a bit off. I might have lost a little weight, but I'm not sure.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any abdominal pain or swelling, particularly in the area of your liver?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any abdominal pain, but I do feel a bit uncomfortable sometimes. No swelling that I've noticed either.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you recently traveled anywhere or been exposed to anyone with a contagious illness?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't traveled anywhere recently, and I don't think I've been around anyone who's sick. Just been hanging out with friends mostly.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you been consuming any alcohol or taking any medications, including over-the-counter drugs or supplements?

speaker: Patient
text: I've been drinking socially on weekends, just a bit, but I haven't taken any medications or supplements recently. I did use some cocaine and ecstasy a while back, though.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any changes in your urine color or stool color, such as dark urine or pale stools?

speaker: Patient
text: I've noticed that my urine has been darker than usual, but I haven't really paid attention to my stool color. It just feels like something's off.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent infections, or do you have a history of liver disease or hepatitis?

speaker: Patient
text: I don't have a history of liver disease or hepatitis, and I haven't had any recent infections that I know of. I feel pretty out of it, though.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent blood tests done, and if so, what were the results?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any blood tests done recently, so I don't know what the results would be. I just came in because I was feeling really agitated and off.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any itching or rashes on your skin?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any itching or rashes on my skin. Just the yellowish color and that feeling of restlessness.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent exposure to toxins or chemicals, either at work or at home?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't been exposed to any toxins or chemicals that I know of. Just the usual stuff around the house, nothing out of the ordinary.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any changes in your mental state, such as increased confusion, memory issues, or mood swings?

speaker: Patient
text: I've definitely been feeling more confused than usual, and my mood swings have been all over the place. It's like I can't think straight or remember things properly.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent vaccinations or medical procedures that could be relevant?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any recent vaccinations or medical procedures. Just the usual check-ups, but nothing out of the ordinary.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in your sleep patterns, such as insomnia or excessive sleepiness?

speaker: Patient
text: I've been having trouble sleeping, like I can't settle down at all. I feel really restless at night and end up tossing and turning.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any headaches or visual disturbances, such as blurred vision or seeing spots?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any headaches, but my vision feels a bit off sometimes, like things are a little blurry. It's hard to focus on anything clearly.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any family history of liver disease or any genetic conditions that could affect your liver function?

speaker: Patient
text: I don't know of any family history of liver disease or genetic conditions. My family seems pretty healthy overall.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent changes in your menstrual cycle, if applicable, or any unusual bleeding?

speaker: Patient
text: I'm a male, so I don't have a menstrual cycle. But I have noticed some unusual nosebleeds lately.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any joint pain or swelling, particularly in your hands or feet?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any joint pain or swelling in my hands or feet. Everything feels pretty normal in that regard.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent dental work or issues with your teeth that could be causing the nosebleeds?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any recent dental work done, and my teeth seem fine. The nosebleeds just started happening out of nowhere.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any unusual bruising or bleeding from other areas, aside from the nosebleeds?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any unusual bruising, but I do feel like I might be more prone to bleeding lately. It's just the nosebleeds that have been bothering me.

speaker: Doctor
text: Based on your symptoms of agitation, yellowish skin and eyes, dark urine, confusion, and recent nosebleeds, I suspect there may be an issue with your liver function. I would like to confirm this with some blood tests. REQUEST TEST: Liver_Function_Tests

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: - Bilirubin: 25 mg/dL (elevated) - AST: 600 IU/L (elevated) - ALT: 650 IU/L (elevated) - TP Activity: < 40% (reduced) - INR: 1.5 (elevated)
